- *This article is about the artifact in the original Convict patch and DynaHack. For other versions, see [Luckblade](/wiki/Luckblade "Luckblade").*

**Luck Blade** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in the original [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch, and also appears unaltered in [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack") and older versions of [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") that integrate the role. It is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")-aligned, and its base item is a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword").

## Generation

A randomly-generated broadsword has a 1⁄20 chance of being created as Luck Blade. It is the first guaranteed [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for Convicts, and chaotic characters may receive Luck Blade as a sacrifice gift.

## Description

Luck Blade has +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals +1d6 damage versus all [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster"). While carried, it functions as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") of the same [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude").

## Strategy

Luck Blade is a decent first weapon for Convicts and other chaotic characters, and can also act as an early [luck item](/wiki/Luck_item "Luck item"), though it is much heavier than a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"). Fortunately for Convicts in particular, it is also an intelligent artifact, giving it a 4⁄5 chance of resisting most item-cursing effects.
